intro: Mesosphaerum homalophyllum, commonly known as the smooth-leaved mesosphaerum, is a member of the family Malvaceae. It is a shrub characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers with five petals, typically in shades of white or pale pink. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds. This species is native to parts of Africa and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
